/**
 * @module useLocalStorage
 * @description A custom React hook that provides persistent storage using localStorage.
 * It syncs state with localStorage and handles serialization/deserialization of stored values.
 * 
 * @example
 * // Using the hook in a component
 * const [value, setValue] = useLocalStorage('storageKey', defaultValue);
 * 
 * @param {string} key - The localStorage key to store the value under
 * @param {any} initialValue - The initial value if no value exists in localStorage
 * @returns {[any, Function]} A tuple containing the stored value and a setter function
 */import{useState,useEffect}from'react';function useLocalStorage(key,initialValue){const[storedValue,setStoredValue]=useState(()=>{try{const item=window.localStorage.getItem(key);return item?JSON.parse(item):initialValue;}catch(error){console.error(error);return initialValue;}});useEffect(()=>{try{window.localStorage.setItem(key,JSON.stringify(storedValue));}catch(error){console.error(error);}},[key,storedValue]);return[storedValue,setStoredValue];}export default useLocalStorage;
